abstract: The Bancroft family is trying to come up with a stronger system for keeping the newsroom independent of Rupert Murdoch.
snippet: The Bancroft family is trying to come up with a stronger system for keeping the newsroom independent of Rupert Murdoch.
lead_paragraph: In 1981, Rupert Murdoch and a division of his News Corporation made extraordinary promises about not meddling in the news pages of The Times of London and The Sunday Times, which they were about to take over. But in short order, no one doubted who was firmly in control of the newsrooms.

headline.main: Independence Still the Issue at Dow Jones
headline.print_headline: Independence Still the Issue At Dow Jones

abstract: The stock market tumbled for a second day over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.
snippet: The stock market tumbled for a second day over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.
lead_paragraph: After rising almost uninterruptedly for three months, the stock market tumbled for a second day yesterday over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: More Fears on Inflation Hit Stocks
headline.print_headline: More Fears On Inflation Hit Stocks

abstract: Another investor has expressed interest in the idea of putting together a rival bid for Dow Jones, the family-controlled publishing company that is fielding a $5 billion takeover offer from Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: Another investor has expressed interest in the idea of putting together a rival bid for Dow Jones, the family-controlled publishing company that is fielding a $5 billion takeover offer from Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation.

headline.main: Philadelphia Inquirer Owner Casts Eye on Dow Jones

abstract: A Los Angeles billionaire and the owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer have already acknowledged that they are interested in a potential counteroffer for Dow Jones & Company. Now it appears that YouTube‘s Chad Hurley or the folks behind Lonelygirl15 may want in as well.
lead_paragraph: A Los Angeles billionaire and the owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer have already acknowledged that they are interested in a potential counteroffer for Dow Jones & Company. Now it appears that YouTube‘s Chad Hurley or the folks behind Lonelygirl15 may want in as well.

headline.main: In Dow Jones Bidding, (Vague) New Names Surface
